pageContext.claim: “Hillary wanted to put up wind. Wind. If you -- if you have a windmill anywhere near your house, congratulations your house just went down 75 percent in value.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a big stretch. Some research shows that property values decline due to proximity to wind turbines, but it's nowhere near 75 percent. A London School of Economics study found that property values declined "5-6% on average for housing with a visible wind farm within 2km, falling to under 2% between 2-4km, and to near zero between 8-14km, which is at the limit of likely visibility."
